version_description:
• Fixed a Toshiba FlashAir timeout issue.
• Minor fixes.

• Support for iOS 11. Drag & Drop on iPad!
• New selection screen with resizable thumbnails.
• New unified media importer with resizable thumbnails.
• Tip Jar is replaced with Add-On in-app purchases. First up: Video Playback.
• Duplicate-check before importing photos from wi-fi cards.
• Fixed a wi-fi card bug that would cause timed out downloads to not be given another try.
• Optimized PQI/Air Direct wi-fi card detection.
• Countless other fixes, nips-n-tucks.

Updates—even .0 releases—are always free. Add-On in-app purchases is a way for me to be paid for adding new features - if you'd like them. Everybody wins.

If you like ShutterSnitch please take a moment to rate / add a review. Thank you!

• The obligatory stability fixes after a .0 release.
• Haptic feedback on warnings, if the device supports it.

• Minor adjustments to layout on iPhone X.
• Added 'Special Instructions' and 'Category' IPTC fields to the Update Metadata action.
• IPTC fields are now also saved to the XMP metadata.
• Bug fixes.

• New add-on: Image Adjustments. ***Special introductory price***: 50% off for the holidays! Get it while it's ..cold?
• Bug fixes

In-app purchases let you support the continued development of ShutterSnitch. Thank you and happy holidays to you all!

***Special introductory price for the new Image Adjustments in-app purchase: 50% off for the holidays!***

• Added a JPEG recompression quality setting for when photos are changed by editing / watermarking / resizing.
• Fixed a pre-processing size selection issue.
• Minor localization adjustments.

In-app purchases let you support the continued development of ShutterSnitch. Thank you and happy holidays to you all!

• Bug fixes

** Heads-up: The holiday sale on the new Image Adjustments in-app purchase will end on January 1st. Get it while it's half off - and Happy New Year! **
• Bug fixes

• Upon updating metadata, Exif Creation Date is now also saved to the relevant IPTC and XMP fields.
• Minor fixes.

Sorry to bang on about it, but if you want to *support further development of ShutterSnitch*, please consider buying the ad-ons.. A heartfelt thanks to the elite few who've done so already!

• Minor fixes.

Sorry to bang on about it, but if you want to *support further development of ShutterSnitch*, please consider buying the add-ons.. A heartfelt thanks to the elite few who've done so already!

• Fixed a deadlock occurring when refreshing the status of running Actions.
• Minor fixes.

A big Thank You to the superheroes buying the add-ons!

• New Image Adjustment add-on feature: Added "Flip Image" to the rotation-button tap-and-hold options.
• Squashed some orientation bugs.
• Lots of minor fixes.

• Fixed an import window crash occurring on iOS 9.
• Minor fixes.

• Added a setting to let iOS handle print formatting. (You'll want to turn this on if you have a Selphy CP1200 printer.)

Tiny update, but don't worry, the good stuff is just not fully baked yet..

• Will now make sure XMP headers are written before IPTC headers when saving metadata.
• Fixed a few crashes occuring on older devices.
• Minor fixes.

• New add-on: Advanced Metadata Editing. Edit the metadata of individual files or set up presets to quickly apply data to a large set of files.
• Tags. Use tags to quickly filter the filmstrip.
• Expanded functionality of the 'Export to Location' action to let you perform an additional task based on the success and/or failure of the export. An example could be to set a red "Upload Failed" tag on failure and a green "Uploaded" tag on success.
• Bug fixes.

• Added Labels. A user asked me if Tags were compatible with Lightroom/Photo Mechanic. No, Tags only live inside ShutterSnitch and you can have multiple Tags per file. As opposed to a Label which is written to the file and is compatible with LR and PM5 Color Labels/Classes. You activate the Labelling mode via the Star-rating button by tapping the button at the top of the rating bar. You can edit Labels and colors via the Options button in the Collection overview.
• Improved rating filter. You can now tap the individual star rating you want to filter on. If you want to toggle all or none, just tap the row title.
• When editing Metadata Editor Presets, you now get an option to create a new one based on the metadata previously copied to the Pasteboard.
• Importing XMP files will now let you choose between creating an 'Update Metadata' Action or a Metadata Editor Preset (if you bought the add-on).
• Added a 'Label' field to the Metadata Editor.
• "Show Listening Info" is removed from the wrench-button options and can instead be invoked by tapping the title bar.
• By popular request the Tip Jar makes its clinking return. (Thank you!)
• Minor fixes

• Added Password Autofill support for Locations.
• Bug fixes and minor optimizations.

• Updated to support the latest SmugMug API. You will need to re-authenticate and select the album you want to upload to.
• Minor fixes.

• Added options to copy/paste/duplicate locations by long-pressing a location while editing the list.
• Improved pairing for Canon UPnP and Sony cameras on networks with multiple DLNA services.
• Completely rewritten Flickr authentication and upload code.
• Added album title to the subject of the email Selection List.
• Fixed a bug that would prevent you from sorting the filmstrip when in star rating filter-mode.
• Fixed an issue where updating metadata would lead to losing the original file-creation date.
• Other minor fixes.

• Owners of the Image Adjustment add-on can now add adjustments copied to the clipboard as an Action in the Action Tasks.
• The Selection List email header is not localized anymore, so the SnitchSync plug-in for Lightroom will understand the header fields from non-english users.
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

• Fixed a metadata update bug occurring with photos having had IPTC information set by Canon EOS cameras.
• Minor fixes.
• Minor fixes.
• Stability improvements.
• Bug fixes.

• The largest 'Max. cache image dimension' setting is now 'Screen Size' - since 2048 pixels weren't quite enough for the large iPad Pro screens.
• Bug fixes.

• Bug fixes.

Thanks to everyone who opts in to send anonymous crash reports!

• Fixed a temperature/tint bug occuring when adjusting photos with temperature/white-point info present in the metadata.
• Minor fixes.

• Fixed an occasional issue with mailing large photos from iPads running iOS11.
• Minor fixes.

• ShutterSnitch is now subscription based.

If you're an existing customer, don't worry, you still have access to everything you've bought so far - but a subscription gives you access to all features and future updates. (And helps me stay in business ..so please sign up.. :)
• Fixed a bug that would cause some services to not initiate correctly when entering a collection.
• Bug fixes.

• New feature for subscribers on iOS 11 and above: Support for exporting via the cellular connection while connected to closed networks (such as a Nikon camera's built-in wi-fi network). If you don't want to risk using the cellular network, 'Mobile Data' can be turned off in the ShutterSnitch settings in the Settings app.
• Minor fixes.

• Sony 'Select on This Device' will now receive the selected files immediately instead of presenting the picker.
• Bug fixes.

• The 'Download only protected files' PTP/IP setting now also works with Nikon cameras introduced after 2015. (Tested on D500, D850, D7500. It also works with JPEGs on D750, you just need to make sure you shoot both NEF+JPEG or else the camera won't trigger the send.)
• Added a 'Share' button option to Limited Mode.
• Bug fixes.

• New Wi-Fi Quick Connect feature (iOS 11 and above). Tap the listening info shown when entering a collection (or when tapping the title bar) to quickly switch between your router / camera / wi-fi card networks. For privacy reasons ShutterSnitch does not have access to information about your wi-fi networks, so you have to add them manually.
• PTP/IP setting 'Download only protected files' expanded to Download 'New files', 'Protected files', and 'New & Protected files'.
• Added support for Nikon Z7.
• Added support for Canon EOS R. Note that selecting-and-sending photos from the camera is not supported. Instead, use the Download 'Protected files' or 'New & Protected files' setting and toggle the protection status of files to transfer them.
• Bug fixes.

• Cleaned up the listening info bar. It now shows the name of the network you're connected to instead of the FTP port and whether Eye-Fi is enabled. (Don't worry, all services are running as they always do.)
• Minor fixes.

• Added Code Replace to the Metadata Editor.
• Added Undo/Redo buttons to the Metadata Editor keyboard toolbar on iPhone.
• Added a setting to choose which buttons are visible in the Metadata Editor keyboard toolbar.
• Added Metadata Editor shortcuts for physical keyboards (press and hold Command to see a list).
• You can now have more toolbar buttons in the browsing interface on narrow screens. If they don't fit, the overflow will collapse to a '•••' button.
• Minor fixes.
• Bug fixes.

• New feature: Pocket Mode. Accessible via the wrench-toolbar-button this mode will ignore accidental touches and turn the screen brightness all the way down to preserve battery life while you shoot with your iOS device in a pocket. iPhone users get a bonus boost since its proximity sensor will turn the display off while the screen is covered. Just make sure you don't turn your device off using the physical sleep/wake button - that'll put ShutterSnitch to sleep after a few minutes.
• Minor refinements.

Thank you to all subscribers for keeping ShutterSnitch alive!
• Bug fixes.
• Bug fix

• Improved caret-focusing in the metadata editor.
• Added "Title / Object Name" to the metadata tokens.
• Improvements and bug fixes.
• Fixed a Code Replace loading bug occurring on iOS 10.
• Bug fixes.

• Added an 'Advanced' page to the in-app settings with options to share configurations and a choice to use device authentication instead of the superuser password.
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

Make your future self happy: Go to the in-app settings, tap the 'Advanced' page at the top of the screen, tap 'Select All' at the bottom of the list, tap 'Share', and send the configuration to your computer or iCloud Drive. You now have a complete backup of your setup (collections excluded).

If you get a new iOS device and don't want to restore a complete iCloud backup to it, it's now easy to transfer all your settings, actions, locations, presets, etc. Just install ShutterSnitch and AirDrop the configuration to the device.

• Added a yearly subscription option.
• Added 'Exposure Bracket value', 'Bracket Mode', and 'Category' to the condition action.
• Added option to 'Share' the Selection List for all the AirDroppers out there.
• Minor fixes.

• Added a navigation-buttons option to the filmstrip.
• Added a few external keyboard shortcuts: navigation, rate, label, zoom - press and hold the Command button for the complete list.
• Action Tasks can now be assigned a keyboard shortcut.
• Added a way to select ranges of files: Select the first file, then tap and hold the last one to get an option to select that whole range.
• When in Selection mode with an external screen connected, selected files will now be laid out there.
• Bug fixes.

• Added an 'Advanced' page to the in-app settings with options to share configurations and a choice to use device authentication instead of the superuser password.
• Bug fixes and minor improvements.

Make your future self happy: Go to the in-app settings, tap the 'Advanced' page at the top of the screen, tap 'Select All' at the bottom of the list, tap 'Share', and send the configuration to your computer or iCloud Drive. You now have a complete backup of your setup (collections excluded).

If you get a new iOS device and don't want to restore a complete iCloud backup to it, it's now easy to transfer all your settings, actions, locations, presets, etc. Just install ShutterSnitch and AirDrop the configuration to the device.

• Sorry to mess with your object recognition circuit but the Share button icon is now a more correct checkmark icon.
• The Metadata Editor now has a page with the non-editable file information.
• The old way of resetting the Superuser password is replaced by a button on the Advanced tab in the in-app settings.
• You'll see the amount of space the cache files take up under in-app settings > Advanced > Rebuild Cache.
• Bonjour discovery in the Location Export sheet looks for WebDAV servers instead of FTP servers (*much* faster transfers).
• Tapping and holding the 'Select All' button when importing from PTP/IP sources will let you select all protected files.
• Saving JPEGs and sibling raw files to the camera roll at the same time will merge them as one asset.
• Now handles opening of .db files in order to more easily add Eyefi card keys.
• Overflow-buttons presented via the "more-dots" wrap if they don't fit on screen.
• More filmstrip sorting options.
• Dragging the slider in the Action Tasks sheet will auto-scroll when it reaches the top or bottom.
• Reduced memory usage when creating thumbnails of adjusted photos.
• Giant foundational code rejiggering to get ready for the future. Hope you don't notice any change.
• Layout and bug fixes.

• Critical bug fix! But don't miss what was new in version 4.7:
-
• Sorry to mess with your object recognition circuit but the Share button icon is now a more correct checkmark icon.
• The Metadata Editor now has a page with the non-editable file information.
• The old way of resetting the Superuser password is replaced by a button on the Advanced tab in the in-app settings.
• You'll see the amount of space the cache files take up under in-app settings > Advanced > Rebuild Cache.
• Bonjour discovery in the Location Export sheet looks for WebDAV servers instead of FTP servers (*much* faster transfers).
• Tapping and holding the 'Select All' button when importing from PTP/IP sources will let you select all protected files.
• Saving JPEGs and sibling raw files to the camera roll at the same time will merge them as one asset.
• Now handles opening of .db files in order to more easily add Eyefi card keys.
• Overflow-buttons presented via the "more-dots" wrap if they don't fit on screen.
• More filmstrip sorting options.
• Dragging the slider in the Action Tasks sheet will auto-scroll when it reaches the top or bottom.
• Reduced memory usage when creating thumbnails of adjusted photos.
• Giant foundational code rejiggering to get ready for the future. Hope you don't notice any change.
• Layout and bug fixes.

• Discovered Toshiba FlashAir, Transcend, or PQI Air cards will show up on the Advanced page of the in-app settings. From there you can disable receiving from it, or rename it by swiping the row - useful for networks with many cards on it.
• Added support for importing images shared from other apps.
• Added Overlays and Slideshow button options to the toolbar.
• Added ability to limit number of visible buttons in the toolbar.
• Bug fixes.
• Quite a few bug fixes.

• Added a metadata token keyboard-toolbar-button to Update Metadata action text fields and now also watermark texts.
• Added 'Discovered Wi-Fi Cards' as a stand-alone configuration sharing option.
• Moved the "Display image masks on" settings to the Image Overlays interface itself.
• Bug fixes.
• Bug fixes.
• Bug fixes.

• Image Masks now also support snapping to slideshow photos.
• Added support for parsing Exif v2.31 timezone offsets.
• The selected-state of the collection thumbnail will now fade out when exiting the collection.
• Fixed a bug that would cause an edited Metadata Preset to lose the changes if the token or quick-paste picker were used to insert text.
• Minor bug fixes and quite a bit of getting-ready-for-the-future.

• A horizontal swipe on the title bar in a collection can now trigger a shortcut. See the settings for available options.
• Fixed a file Drag & Drop and a PTP/IP disconnect issue.
• Minor bug fixes.

• Added entering Limited Mode to the title bar swipe shortcuts.
• Bug fixes and making sure we look good in the future.
• Bug fixes
• Bug fixes.
• Bug fixes
• Fixed a Code Replace loading bug occurring on iOS 10.

• Improved automatic recovery if bad things happen.
• Minor iOS 13 related bug fixes.
• Bug fixes related to iOS 13.2.

• Added a pre-processing option for export locations to also upload sibling files with certain file extensions.
• Fixed a download-on-protect bug on Nikon D850 cameras using a secondary card a backup.
• Minor bug fixes.

• Added support for adjusting the position of image overlays on iOS 11 and above. Tap and hold the overlay in the browser and pick 'Adjust overlay' from the menu options.
• Added a 'Collections Pane' setting to show the collection overview as a pane on iPad. Side benefit: You can move between collections without losing the connection to your camera.
• Bug fixes.
• Bug fixes

• Added support for more metadata fields in the token picker.
• Fixed parsing of exif thumbnails from EOS M100 cameras.
• Bug fixes.

• Better support for the new pointer feature in iPadOS 13.4.
• Bug fixes.

• Added support for Sony ⍺7R IV 'PC Remote' shooting.
• Changed the low disk space warning limit to 200MB and added improved auto-recovery in case the collection database is corrupted when running out of space.
• Minor fixes.

• Upgraded the video player to also handle sound clips.
• Added File Age and Time Zone Warnings.
• Added a Time Zone Condition Action.
• Added a Change Time Zone Action.
• Fixed a Nikon auto-send resume bug.
• Minor fixes.

• Added 'Suppress warnings' options to the Warnings sheet.
• Added a title-swipe shortcut to switch between downloading New or Protected PTP/IP files.
• Added a Location Pre-processing option to send images in the HEIF format. Requires iOS 11 or higher.
• iOS 13.6 related bug fix.
• Minor fixes.

• Don't panic! No settings have been removed - just moved into categorized sub-pages.
• Introducing the new Grid browsing mode.
- Tap and hold the title-bar to edit the toolbar.
- Tap and hold a thumbnail to change which details you would like to see below it.
- Tap the green status-dot in the top right-hand corner to see log info or to manually import from the camera roll or connected devices.
• Services will no longer be shut down when exiting a collection. The last active collection is kept alive and ready to receive files. Entering a new collection makes that the active one.
• Added support for connecting to multiple PTP/IP cameras at a time.
• Added Zoom to fit/100% (Z) and Zoom Lock (L) keyboard shortcuts to the image viewer.
• Added the ability to tap the left and right side of the image viewer to navigate, preserving zoom, when in full-screen mode.
• Added a 'Discovered UPnP Devices' to the Advanced settings tab. Once discovered you can specify if you want to ignore them. Swipe to the left on the row for editing options.
• Added 'Review' to the external screen modes.
• Tags are now shown in the top left-hand corner when browsing photos in full screen.
• Added a title bar swipe shortcut for switching highlight warnings off and on.
• Fixed an issue causing Canon 1Dx cameras to fail after 30 photos if 'Overwrite same file' was disabled.
• Finally found a solution for auto-connecting to Panasonic cameras in Direct mode. Better 7 years late than never?
• Version info is moved to a refreshed About sheet which also includes the complete version history.
• Fixed a HEIC export bug occurring on iOS 13.
• Fixed a PQI card discovery issue eventually causing a reboot on iOS 13.
• Bug fixes.

• Copying/pasting of local objects on iOS 14 now uses a private pasteboard. Go to Settings -> General -> 'Pasteboard for local objects' if you want to go back to using the system pasteboard.
• Fixed a video-loading crash issue on iOS 14.
• Minor fixes.
• Bug fixes
• iOS 14 related bug fixes.

• While we wait for iOS to support parsing Canon's latest CR3 format we'll fall back on the embedded JPEG preview image.
• Fixed a PTP/IP timeout/cancelling bug.
• Code Replace replacement values can now begin and end with whitespace characters.
• Bug fixes.

• Fixed a communication issue with Fujifilm GFX 100 cameras during burst shots.
• Fixed an auto-jump issue in the Grid mode on iOS 14.
• Minor fixes.

• Added a location pre-processing option to recompress photos to a maximum file size.
• Added setting to toggle the visibility of the bottom navigation bar in the Grid mode browser.
• Minor fixes.

• Added 'convert to HEIC', 'recompress to a max file size', and 'watermark' options to the 'Change Photo' and 'Save to Camera Roll' actions.
• Updated to the latest Dropbox SDK (5.0.5).
• Minor fixes.

• Added ability to use tokens in the Album name of the 'Change Photo' and 'Save to Camera Roll' actions.
• Added ability to use tokens in FTP, WebDAV, Google Drive, and Dropbox upload paths.
• Added 'Current Date/Time' token.
• Added a setting (Settings -> General -> 'Default Action per collection') to allow picking the default Action on a per collection basis.
• Made the left and right navigation tap targets in the fullscreen viewer a lot narrower, so double-tapping to zoom works on a larger area.
• Bug fixes.

• Fixed an issue creating folders using tokens if the upload had sibling-files accompanying it (such as XMP, WAV..).
• Minor fixes.

• Added support for navigation/rating/running Actions using a game controller (in-app Settings -> Advanced tab). Requires iOS 14.
• Added rating/color label info to the external Review screen.
• Added an indicator for the 'Jump to New Files' state in Grid mode.
• Minor fixes.

• Added a 'Toggle Rating Filter' option for game controllers.
• Fixed a WebDAV upload issue occurring on very picky servers.
• Minor fixes.
• Bug fixes

• Added options to change the format of date and time in the Change Filename action.
• Minor fixes.
